Summary:

As the Analytics Insights Director, you will be responsible for leading and overseeing the development and execution of data-driven insights and strategies for the Deposit Product organization. Your primary focus will be to leverage data and advanced analytics to drive business growth, shape the Consumer Regional Banks deposit strategy, and enhance decision-making across various segments. You will manage a team of data analysts and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to identify opportunities and deliver actionable insights.

Location: Columbus, OH

  • Team Leadership: Build and lead a high-performing team of data analysts and other related professionals. Provide guidance, mentorship, and support to foster their professional growth.
  • Insights Generation: Drive the development and implementation of advanced analytics techniques, including but not limited to statistical analysis and predictive modeling to extract meaningful insights from large and complex datasets.
  • Reporting and Visualization: Develop and maintain reporting frameworks and data visualization tools to present key insights and trends in a clear and concise manner. Enable stakeholders to make data-driven decisions through intuitive and actionable dashboards.
  • Performance Measurement: Partner to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track the effectiveness of annual planning efforts, strategic initiatives, and new product launches.
  • Business Partner Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, pricing, marketing, sales, finance, and digital to identify opportunities for leveraging data insights to drive business growth and operational efficiency.
  • Communication and Presentation: Present insights, findings, and recommendations to senior executives and stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner. Be able to effectively communicate complex analytical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Continuous Improvement: Foster a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and improvement within the data and analytics team. Encourage the adoption of best practices, new methodologies, and emerging trends in the field.
  • Data Management: Oversee the collection, storage, and management of data assets, ensuring data quality, integrity, and security.
  • Technology Evaluation: Stay informed about emerging technologies, tools, and platforms in the data and analytics space. Evaluate their potential to enhance data analysis capabilities and drive innovation within the organization.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field such as data science, statistics, computer science, or a related discipline.
  • Proven experience (Min 5+ years) in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a focus on driving insights and strategic decision-making.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in a relevant field such as data science, statistics, computer science, or a related discipline.
  • Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team.
  • Deep understanding of data analysis methodologies, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools and technologies (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and advanced analytics tools (e.g., Python, R, or SAS).

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong business acumen and the ability to align data-driven insights with strategic business objectives.
  • Experience in developing and implementing data governance and data management practices.

Application Innovation and Evolution
